intro: Martensianthus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered martensia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Martensianthus micranthus is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils.
